title: DevOps
description:
Tu participeras activement à la réalisation de notre vision DevOps en intégrant toutes ses constituantes dans nos pipelines de livraison. Concrètement, tu travailleras avec les membres de ton équipe pour développer des solutions de déploiement telles que :
Mise en place de pipeline CI/CD
Gestion complète des ouvertures de flux en utilisant de l’infrastructure as code
Intégration des solutions de scanning de sécurité
Environnement de travail :
Hébergement de nos plateformes sur AWS (Pipeline, EC2, ECS, S3, RDS, ElasticBeanstalk…)
BaseCamp pour la gestion de projets
Docker
Contrôle de version (GitHub)
Rapport et tableaux de bord
Monitoring des applications (AWS CloudWatch)
WordPress (PHP, ACF, jQuery, Vanilla JS, SCSS/CSS3)
Python + React
Responsabilités principales :
Accompagner les lignes d’affaires à intégrer un nouvel outil dans un contexte DevOps
Mettre en œuvre et supporter le provisionnement des environnements AWS
Automatiser les tâches de déploiement et de gestion de la configuration pour une meilleure efficacité
Assurer la disponibilité, la performance et la sécurité de tous les services AWS
Collaboration avec les développeurs pour implémenter les meilleures pratiques DevOps
Participer à la mise en place et à la gestion des outils de surveillance et de rapport pour les environnements AWS
Contribuer aux avancées de pratiques et favoriser leurs adoptions
Amélioration de la performance, réduction de coûts, entretien des environnements en place
Migration de compte AWS
L’équipe travaille en mode hybride, à Montréal, avec quelques occasions nécessitant de se regrouper pour développer la complicité d’équipe. Nous visons également à t’offrir un maximum de flexibilité dans ton travail pour favoriser ta qualité de vie. Ceci se traduit notamment par l’aménagement du temps de travail pour concilier vie professionnelle et personnelle, et des congés flexibles à des moments qui comptent.
5 années d’expérience pertinente en DevOps ou SysAdmin
Maîtrise du français requis
Expérience en DevOps, notamment en automatisation et en gestion de la configuration
Connaissance de services AWS
Expérience en programmation (PHP, Python, React, etc.)
Connaissance des meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité AWS
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à communiquer efficacement avec les différents départements de l’entreprise
Bilingue : Capacité à communiquer en anglais (pour traiter avec des fournisseurs anglophones à l’extérieur du Québec)
Travailler chez Groupe Contex, c’est profiter d’avantages, tels que :
Un environnement de travail stimulant, flexible et créatif ;
Un poste permanent avec un horaire de travail de 35 heures par semaine ;
Un mode de travail hybride : combinaison de télétravail et de présentiel ;
Une politique de télétravail à l’étranger ;
L’accès gratuit à de la télémédecine et une vaste gamme de professionnels via Dialogue ;
Un programme complet d’assurances collectives ;
Un REER collectif avec contribution de l’employeur ;
Un programme de bonification à l’atteinte des objectifs annuels ;
Un généreux programme de vacances annuelles, incluant une fermeture des bureaux entre Noël et le Jour de l’an ;
Un horaire d’été ;
Bureaux facilement accessibles en transport en commun ;
La possibilité d’assister à plusieurs de nos formations et de nos conférences.
Nos environnements de travail dynamiques et nos outils de collaboration modernes favorisent une expérience employée agréable. Nous accordons une grande place aux idées des employés. Que ce soit par nos sondages, ou encore par l’entremise de nos programmes, le dialogue en continu et la rétroaction sont encouragés.

Assurance Dentaire
Assurance Invalidité

REER Collectif

title: Azure DevOps
description:
Unleash Engagement with Metalab! Join our team in transforming user experiences!
Level up your skills and be part of the gaming revolution!
Metalab is the proud SI arm of a group of companies, including Alice & Smith (A&S) and Youville Haussmann Park (YHP). YHP and A&S are partner studios that specialize in applying gaming mechanics and ideology across a wide range of industries and brands. Our cutting-edge gamification engine, built on Microsoft Azure PlayFab, empowers companies to create captivating ecosystems.
YHP is renowned for its expertise in engagement and experiential activations, working with Red Bull, Bugatti, Genetec, BRP, and more.
A&S is a master of gaming fandom and PR, as well as a pioneer in the world of Alternate Reality Games (ARGs). Clients include Hello Games, Paradox Interactive, Twitch, and more.
YHP is an agency that creates experiences. Not just brand experiences, not just experiential, not just events. Its specialty is to create palpable emotions to create a lasting commitment between a brand and its consumers, and thus strengthen the bond between them. YHP partners with its clients to plan, execute and capture sensory and memorable moments. Drawing on industry best practices, YHP designs experiential campaigns that are always remarkably well thought out, both online and in person.
A&S is a world leader in the development and integration of Microsoft Azure PlayFab technology. A&S also created XR Server, a no-code API toolkit that empowers brands to operate LiveOps-driven engagement campaigns with consummate ease. XR Server is the culmination of decades of gamification experience, expertise, and success.
We are now looking to grow our Azure DevOps team at our Montreal office.
As an Azure DevOps, you will:
Build, implement, and manage robust CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps tools for efficient software deployment.
Administer and optimize Linux-based systems to ensure high availability, security, and performance.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve issues related to infrastructure, deployments, and application performance.
Implement and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like Terraform and/or Bicep for Azure resources.
Ensure compliance with security and regulatory standards in all aspects of Azure cloud and Linux administration.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance and optimize cloud-based applications for scalability and reliability.
Provide technical expertise and support to team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration.
Requirements:
Tech Skills:
Minimum 3 to 5 years of experience, ideally with a solid combination of Azure DevOps expertise + Linux SysAdmin background.
Own Azure Certification(s) – Ideally (but not exhaustive):
- Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate
- Microsoft Certified: DevOps Engineer Expert
- Microsoft Certified: Azure Network Engineer Associate
- Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert…
Proven experience in setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps tools.
Hands-on experience with tools such as Terraform and Bicep/ARM templates for automating infrastructure deployment and management.
Strong proficiency in Azure services, including but not limited to virtual machines, storage, networking, and security.
Expertise in administering Linux-based systems, with a focus on performance optimization, security, and troubleshooting.
Proficient in scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Bash, az cli) for automating routine tasks and creating efficient workflows.
Understanding of security best practices in Azure and the ability to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Experience in implementing monitoring solutions and diagnosing and resolving infrastructure and application issues.
Soft skills:
Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrated commitment to staying updated on emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in cloud and DevOps.
Solid communication skills in English.
Nice to have:
French proficiency.
Hands-on experience with tools such as Packer for automating image deployment.
Hands-on experience with tools such as Ansible for configuration management.
Knowledge of containerization technologies, preferably Docker, and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
Knowledge of event driven and API typologies and patterns.
Being physically in Montreal as a best option, Canada in the EST time zone at least.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $77,683.70-$129,650.30 per year
Benefits:
Dental care
Extended health care
Paid time off
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Experience:

Linux SysAdmin: 2 years (required)
Language:
English (required)
Licence/Certification:
Azure Certifications (required)
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Montréal, QC H4C 3C5

title: DevOps Platform
description:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.
Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.
Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.
Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.
About the role
We are looking for a DevOps to join our growing DevOps Platform and COE team!
Our team is composed of a diversified mix of DevOps specialists, developpers, integrator and DevOps Coaches building a platform and an ecosystem to be used by hundreds of developers in dozens of software engineering teams in Intact.
The ecosystem allows to build new environments, integrate and deploy code continuously while running automated tests, update observability tools in order to support continuous improvement across the full software development lifecycle.
What you’ll do here:
Ensure best practices in configuration management, development cycle and security are being followed.
Work closely with software engineering teams to support them in the process of using the development lifecycle tool chain and platforms.
Assist software engineering teams in upgrading their current tools and technologies to the DevOps COE recommendations.
Support software engineering teams in their use of DevOps tools and processes to improve their efficiency.
Continuously improve our DevOps tools and processes.
Participate actively in the company's DevOps Community of Practice.
Develop technical initiatives to make software engineering teams more effective.
Participate in R&D initiatives on our technical solutions in connection with our tools, platforms and processes.
What you bring to the table:
Undergraduate degree in computer science or any combination of equivalent education and experience.
3-5 years of IT experience.
Excellent knowledge of DevOps technologies: Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Nexus/Nexus IQ, Maven.
Excellent knowledge of software engineering tools: GitHub, Jira, Confluence.
Very good extended knowledge of different technologies such as: Tomcat, JBoss, Websphere, VM Ware, Ubuntu Linux, etc.
Very good knowledge of scripting: Groovy, Python, Ansible, Bash, YAML, Perl.
Knowledge of cloud technologies: AWS and Azure.
Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code tools: Ansible, Terraform.
Experience with monitoring and alert technologies: Grafana, Prometheus, Dynatrace, Splunk.
Knowledge in the integration of test automation frameworks: Selenium, Cucumber, JMeter.
Good knowledge of Java and Java JEE development environments.
Good knowledge of Agile development environment (SCRUM and Kanban).
Experience of build processes and continuous deployment (CI/CD).
Knowledge of the following technologies is an asset: Twistlock, Veracode, SonarQube, SysDig, SpringBoot, Harshicorp Vault.
Leadership skills.
Communication skills.
Team player, collaborative and good learning ability.
Autonomous and excellent management of priorities.
Versatile and abreast of new technologies.
Curious, self-taught and active in DevOps communities.
Initiative and ability to work under pressure.
Must be bilingual (French / English) – Need to interact on a regular basis with colleagues across the country.
No Canadian work experience required however must be eligible to work in Canada.

L'intégration de systèmes et l’automatisation de processus
D’implanter et tester les fonctionnalités de nos logiciels
De gérer des OBS (bugs) et de trouver les solutions appropriées pour les corriger

D’offrir un soutien technique aux équipes de développement et de projet qui utilisent les fonctionnalités développées par ton équipe

Au plaisir de te rencontrer!
